p.span: Welcome to the Odoo Library package!
This module optimizes your library's daily operations by streamlining product rentals, customer subscriptions, and the management of both in-house events and your website's online catalog.
Odoo offers a complete solution to enhance efficiency and improve customer satisfaction across all your library services.

template.p: You can access every installed App in your Odoo database on your main dashboard.

li.p: The Point of Sale (PoS) handles all product rentals and client service charges.
The Return App tracks and registers all customer returns.
The Subscription App manages member subscriptions and special pricing.
The Events App organizes and publishes all your events.
The Website App manages your events and online catalog, allowing customers to book products directly.

template.p: Membership subscriptions offer a powerful way to manage your pricing. By linking predefined pricelists to customers with active subscriptions, you gain the flexibility to set different rates (or even offer free access) that automatically adjust based on whether a customer is a member.
This ensures that member-exclusive pricing is always applied correctly.

ul.li: Access the "Membership Subscription" product. Navigate to the Recurring Prices tab and define the recurring price, specifying whether it's Yearly or Monthly.
Adapt the Members Pricelist from Subscription / Products / Pricelists. This pricelist will determine the special pricing for members, while non-members will be charged the standard product prices.
To simplify future transactions, add a barcode reference to your customer contact forms

ol.li: Open the Subscription app and create a new subscription.
Select the customer. If they don't exist yet, you can create them directly from the customer field
Add the Membership Subscription product to the lines.

div.p: Don't forget to manage ongoing subscriptions by either renewing or closing them, and consider sending an automated email reminder before they expire
To process a client payment from the terminal, simply open a PoS session and select 'Membership Subscription' from the services category

template.p: To efficiently manage your product catalog, you can upload items in bulk, create them individually, and publish them online. Additionally, you can establish various categories for both your website's display and your internal organizational needs.

div.p: Within the Point of Sales App

ul.li: Use the provided XLS template in the product import page to quickly add multiple products.
When creating a new product, simply enter the barcode. If it's already in the barcodelookup database, the system will automatically populate relevant information.
Organize your inventory using three distinct category types:
Product categories for your internal classification
E-commerce categories for the website sections
Point Of Sale categories for your POS display

li.p: After creating a product, remember to publish it to your e-commerce catalog so it's visible online.

template.p: You can efficiently handle all aspects of rented products directly from the POS interface by simply scanning or selecting items. This includes processing payments for new rentals and applying any additional charges, all within the same streamlined system.

div.p: Odoo's Point of Sale system is designed to handle a wide array of payment methods.

li.p: Open the Point of Sale App and start a session from your library.
Select the customer using the customer button, or simply scan their barcode.
Select or scan all the products to be rented.
Proceed to payment using the client's chosen method.

‚ÄãOnce validated, one or more return orders are automatically created in the Return App. If you handle different rental periods (like 7 days for board games and 21 days for books), Odoo will create a separate return order for each distinct rental period.

ul.li: Never change the quantity in the PoS to extend a rental period! The quantity in the PoS always represents the number of products being rented. If you need to extend the rental duration, adjust the "Scheduled return date" directly within the Return App.

template.p: The Return app streamlines the entire process, from handling incoming returns and processing them efficiently, to sending automated reminder emails for late returns. You'll also gain a clear overview of all products expected back, helping you maintain accurate inventory and provide excellent customer service.

ul.li: You can customize the authorized rental period by PoS category. For each line, you can adjust the Name, the Lead Time, and the specific PoS categories it applies to.

The "Standard" line is used as the default if no categories are assigned to other lines. If you only have one standard rental period, simply use this line and leave all category fields empty on the other lines.
To edit a line, check the box next to it.
It will always take the first available settings in the sequence
If no data is set, it will apply to all categories.

ol.li: Open the Return App to view all returns awaiting processing.
In the search bar, you have a couple of ways to find a return order:
By Customer Information (Primary Search), you can either
Manually type the customer's name or company.

li.p: By Product Information (Secondary Search), you can either
Scan the product barcode.
Manually type the product name or reference.

ol.li: Once you open a return order, you have two options:

li.p: Confirm all products at once by clicking the Validate button.
Adapt the quantity on each line if you only want to validate a portion of the products. Odoo will automatically create a new return order for any remaining items.

div.p: From the search bar, you can also filter for All "late" returns. Once you open a late return order, you can send a predefined email reminder to the customer directly from the chatter to prompt them to return the products to the library.

template.p: Your website's e-commerce feature allows customers to reserve products online for later pickup at your library.
If you want a customer to reserve products online, follow these steps. (If you want to disable reservations, skip to the "Disable Reservations" section below.)

li.p: Select the Customer: In the Contact app, find and select the customer you want to give website access to.
Verify Pricelist: Make sure their Sales parameters show the correct pricelist.
Grant Portal Access: At the top of the page, click the gear icon ‚öôÔ∏è and choose "Grant portal access."
Confirm Access: In the pop-up window, click "Grant Access."

template.p: Your customer will then get an email with a link to connect to your online catalog.
You'll receive an email or notification whenever a customer places a new order.

o_editor_banner_content o-contenteditable-true w-100 px-3
div.p: If you don't pick the reserved products from your inventory promptly, another customer could take them, and you might not be able to fulfill the reservation!

template.p: When the customer comes to Pick Up a Reservation

li.p: Open POS Session: Start your Point of Sale (POS) session.
Settle the Order: Click the three dots (...), select "Quotation/order," then find the correct order and choose "Settle the order."
Process as Usual: Complete the transaction just like a regular rental order.

p.span: If you need to turn off the reservation option:

li.p: Click on "Pricelists."
Remove your website from the Ecommerce tab for the default pricelist.
Add your website to the Ecommerce tab for the website pricelist.
Turn on the setting "Prevent Sale of Zero Priced Product."
